dmca.title: [ABUSE] Stealing of content from my web site
dmca.body:
nc 

-----Original Message-----
From: The Planet Policy Enforcement [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] 
Sent: Monday, June 13, 2005 6:13 PM
To: doug@9spot.net
Cc: copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: [Fwd: [ABUSE] Stealing of content from my web site]

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

Your email is being sent to our copyright-related legal counsel at the
address copyright@theplanet.com for consideration.

- -------- Original Message --------
Subject: [ABUSE] Stealing of content from my web site
Date: Mon, 13 Jun 2005 10:19:11 -0400
From: Douglas Hanna <doug@9spot.net>
To: abuse@theplanet.com

To Whom it May Concern:

My name is Douglas Hanna and I own NeoNewsNow.com. Upon browsing a web site
that is hosted in your data center (neonewsinc.com) I found that they had
stolen content from me.

Their page:
http://www.neonewsinc.com/avatarhelp.php

Our page:
http://avatars.neonewsnow.com

The only difference is that ours is divided up into pages, and theirs is on
one page, but if you looked around everything else is exactly the same.

I saw in the name server listing they were hosted by NextDesigns.net, but
their name server information was under a Whois Protect service, so I used
NeoTrace and did an IP Trace and found out they were hosted at The Planet.

I am an administrator with a company that has thirteen servers at The
Planet, and this will represent how you typically act in situations like
these.

As for my web site, it has close to 4,000 members, and gets 5,000 unique
hits per day, as for theirs, it has under 200 members, and gets only a
hundred or two hundred unique hits per day.

Thanks,
Douglas Hanna


- --
Thanks,
Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/aup/
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE-----
Version: GnuPG v1.2.5 (MingW32)
Comment: Using GnuPG with Thunderbird - http://enigmail.mozdev.org

iD8DBQFCrhMBvK/XpJs6oyURAhflAJsGK/iKWAINHQbDhwz5Wba/0DYu0QCeOGnb
TaGCZX3ix3EtVGcxr7mtvKc=
=3m7B
-----END PGP SIGNATURE-----
